content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clear problem. I enjoyed solving it in C++.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it is well done

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a nice sorting problem

Small comment, I think you should add:

Next n Lines: String representing a gift, with the name and type separated by a comma in the form: name,type

Goal
* Last sentence: Suggest to add "by [[name]]" to the end.

Output
* Suggest to change "next" to "in the order described in the statement".

Constraints
* Test 3 (Missing Types) and Test 4 (Lots of Gifts) violate the last constraint. Please do one of the following:
  ‚Ä¢ remove the last constraint, or
  ‚Ä¢ add {{-}} to the last constraint, and also add a name containing a hyphen to Validator 3 and Validator 4, or
  ‚Ä¢ change "yo-yo" to another name which doesn't contain a hyphen.

* Similarly for Test 1 which contains "PS5".

Cases
* Validator 5: Please change the input so that it is more similar to the corresponding test: (a) fewer instances of "aaa"s, (b) some repeated instances of another name, and (c) the order of the names in input is different from that in output.

Thanks.

Oops ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Updated, thank you!

(It sent twice so I deleted the duplicate, which then deleted both of them ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è)
